@jlhallwriter She’s studying with hopes for doing a politics degree. ‘We all want to go back and fix Sudan’. She is brilliant and I think her Dad might start a blog soon which I can share. X
@JoeChudley @thatcontentshed I had no idea about how to pronounce hyperbole for, like, SO LONG. Bourgeois and bourgeoisie still trip me up.
@jlhallwriter People living in terror, it seems, nowhere feels safe; and getting any info out is done with risk to livelihood/limbs/life. Just awful. Her family are desperately worried. X
One of my daughter’s best friends is Sudanese-Scots. She’s been telling us about what’s going on there. Catching up with it on the news tonight too. Horrifying.

@BaddPreacher @robertshap1 And glad to hear he’s nodded off - dogs generally don’t sleep quietly thru pain so fingers crossed he’s improving. My dog’s around 80% deaf and we used to live too remotely for vets when we had collies - picked up a few tips!

@BaddPreacher @robertshap1 Is he a keen swimmer? Mine is but it really isn’t great for his ears despite him being a water retriever. I limit him to no more than once a month now to save ear bother. Some dogs can also have really weird reactions to post-anaesthesia behaviours. Collies particularly. 🤔
@JennyLConstable That is basically the height of sophistication. 🙌🏼 I’ll just sit over here with my pickled onion and cheddar tin foil hedgehog.
RT @MsYellowHat: After hearing so many horrible stories, I count myself lucky that up until now the worst I’ve had whilst out running alone…
@MsYellowHat JFC what an absolute f’ing arse. I’m so sorry to hear this happened to you Jenny and glad you called police. X
@huxley06 😍🖤

@JennyLConstable Holy shit how did this happen? I accepted a piece of one in a bread recently. Progress is slow.
@nortonmum YAS! Start making sculptures 🖤

@BaddPreacher @robertshap1 < Meantime I’d massage all round the areas surrounding his ears and the back of his jaw, then a quick tour outdoors to see if you can entice him to shake his head, it may help reset pressure as, like yawning, I believe it does something helpful in ear canals, as might swallowing.

@BaddPreacher @robertshap1 I’m not sure about aspirin because it’s same category as ibuprofen (non steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs) and I know they are definitely not ok for dogs, question over paracetamol too, I think. Call vet. Poor pooch! >

I’m not ok with what’s happening for Andy Murray. Mixing pain, physical or mental, with any ideas of endurance is not right. I feel for him and respect him so much but can’t help wondering what in our society/his mindset doesn’t make quitting pro tennis right now a no-brainer.

@kirstofcomms TAKE IT. Full blessings. 🙏🏼
@PretzelEmpress Bless him. He couldn’t buy a vegan sausage roll the other day once he found out the Piers Morgan outrage was a PR set-up. 😂👍🏼🙏🏼
Also: DIDN’T HAPPEN. I’ll just get in there and say that pre-emptively before some life-tired, yawnfest bloke shows up. Be sated and return to your wanksock, fragile one.

My children, apparently Chidi and Eleanor from The Good Place (minus all sexual connotations) have gone into town to get daughter’s nose pierced. Son (studying philosophy): ‘mum I’ll remind her 5 minutes before it’s a major decision and ask her to question herself one last time’.

@Pols80 And yours does mine! How f’ing lucky are we?! Another bonus: you’ll be showing the kids how we work at our goals, slowly and surely, and how we treasure each bit of progress. I know that’s you.

@Pols80 Your house is beautiful, safe and warm. Make time to breathe out and enjoy the journey. You’re enough. It’s all enough. And once you’re the central belts best Uni Creative Writing Tutor, decorators ALL OVER THE FUCKIN’ SHOP.

@Pols80 Stop. Do one room at a time yourselves. Aim to be finished all 3 in 3 or 6 months. Good enough is good enough. I’ve been doing the kitchen for 14 months. No one’s died and we’ve had good times anyway. X
@The_Scotia @RobertJSomynne Bloody lovely 🖤
RT @The_Scotia: .@RobertJSomynne not holding back. UK state is ‘corrupt, broken, hell-bent on aggression’. But what for Scotland on the wor…
@standardnews Scottish writer, 42, dies laughing at jambon fume’s stunning lack of reality-tested self-awareness.
@astrantiaroma Yeah, I’m keeping an eye on what our nearest one runs out of most quickly & will ask them specifically next time what their concerns are & try to help where poss.
@astrantiaroma It’s a really tight squeeze straight on the back of Xmas but I’m also thinking it’s there to share with foodbanks too, if things get extremely hairy for them.
@DomM_G_ Exactly :-) And lol at Mrs Winterson, I love that. 😂 From a mental health point of view it makes me feel calmer to know this is done, contingency plan, etc.

@DomM_G_ I can’t say enough I don’t want to panic folk, sorry about that. I wondered about posting it, I’m very anti the whole doomsday thing outside of Brexit but concerned about transport & supply chains too, plus worry re husband’s job.

@DomM_G_ Beans, passatta, pasta, rice, tins & long life things. I managed to get a new epipen down in France. I have lots of flour & things in too. We’ll use all this anyway. I’ll also get a couple of months’ supply of cetirizine for my allergies.
Meanwhile I started my calm, just-in-case, this-feels-crazy-but-the-last four-years-have-felt-crazy-so.... Brexit shopping yesterday. https://t.co/MwrzKTi4HJ

@helengonewrong @PatMcClay Genuinely excited for it to be OVER. 😂
@helengonewrong @PatMcClay Daughter is a fan of fake tan so her sheet often comes out like the Turin Shroud. 😂
@helengonewrong @PatMcClay That’s pretty much exactly my house! I’m making headway with the reluctant young one by getting him to swap out pillowcases twice as often. 😂

@sioncorn It is and it can be overwhelming. I think working on one thing at a time is just fine, especially if you’ve identified that thing as being a source of pain or trauma, or a repetition of a cycle you know is grim. X

@byrnesong Awwwww! That’s lovely! Jim Leighton was our neighbour at one point when I was wee :-) We used to go round and touch his car sometimes or play kerbie outside his house. He had a Ford, I think... 🤔

@Bluebirdlouise Good policy 👌🏼 Makes sense.
@PatMcClay Omg. This reminds me of my granny making us ‘air the sheets’ in the bollocking freezing cold bedroom with the windows rammed open first thing. 🥶

@PatMcClay I’m shook by once a week, Pat. I’m probs every 2-3 weeks, sometimes longer, so I feel like a mink now. 😂
